jobDescription: Whistle was born out of our love for pets. As the worlds first technology company dedicated to helping pets live longer and happier lives, we build solutions for common problems faced by pet parents everywhere. Whether a pet is an escape artist, an avid adventurer or a happy couch potato, Whistle provides information and insights to help ensure both pets and their people stay healthy and happy for years to come.Our current market-leading products include a cellular-enabled GPS tracker and a WiFi & Bluetooth-enabled activity monitor. We do all design and development in-house, from PCB design to embedded software, data analytics to mobile apps. Our pack thrives on solving hard problems in nimble teams.Backed by the largest petcare company in the world, Whistle is now embarking on one of the largest big data health initiatives in the world; the Pet Insight Project (www.petinsight.com). By observing pets behavior and health histories with unprecedented detail and scale, we seek to detect previously unseen patterns that are early indicators of changes in well-being. This role is a part of the Pet Insight team and will be critical in the research and development of this next generation of petcare.If you believe you have what it takes to work in a highly independent, fast-paced environment where teamwork is critical and flexibility is a must, then Whistle might be the place for you. Whistle is looking for a skilled and dynamic engineer that is excited to improve the health of pets by aggregating and learning from large datasets only available to us. You will be a core team member on a small fast-moving team. As such you will play a central role where you wear many hats and contribute across the stack. You will:Design, develop, implement, test, and maintain a system to help Whistle ingest and understand a pets medical history. This will involve developing an ETL pipeline to ingest medical records along with text processing to help extract meaningful events.Maintain and extend systems related to the ingestion and processing of sensor-based time-series data.Contribute to the deployment and scaling of machine learning and predictive algorithms in a production environment.Understand and evaluate the performance of the system and communicate those to the rest of the team.Here's what we're looking for in a strong candidate:Technical degree (BS/MS in Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Physics).2+ years experience in software development, and familiarity with the Python analytics tools suites (pandas, numpy, Jupyter notebooks, etc.).Experience developing and scaling data pipelines and ETL processes.Strong experience with SQL, including work with large databases and legacy databases.Knowledge of statistics and the ability to communicate clearly with graphs and visuals.Extra treats for:Experience working with electronic medical records (EMRs).Experience with natural language processing (NLP) and text mining.Experience with machine learning, including scikit-learn, tensorflow, and statsmodels.Understanding or interest in machine learning techniques
